de.polygonal.ds.Set

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A set is a collection of unique values. The value is its own key.

Constructor

new(?weak : Bool)
parameters
weak If true, weak keys are used - a value is lost when no other object besides this set holds a reference to the value. Default is false.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this set.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this set.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this set contains x.

has(x : T) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null (if debug flag is set).
Returns true if x exists.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if the set is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements.

remove(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or x does not exist (if debug flag is set).
Removes x.

removeIfExists(x : T) : Bool

returns
True if x was removed.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null (if debug flag is set).
Removes x only if x exists.

set(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or x already exists (if debug flag is set).
Adds x to the set.

setAll(x : Set<T>, assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Void

Adds all values in x to this set. If assign is true the copier argument is ignored and primitives are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false, and copier is null, the method assumes that all values implement the Cloneable interface. In this case val.clone() is used for duplicating values. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

setIfAbsent(x : T) : Bool

returns
True if x was added.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null (if debug flag is set).
Adds x only if x does not exist yet.

size() : Int

The total number of elements in this set.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array in a random order. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var s = new de.polygonal.ds.Set();
	  s.set(0);
	  s.set(1);
	  s.set(2);
	  trace(s); //output:

	  {Set, size: 3}
	  |<
	    0
	    1
	    2
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector in a random order. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
